javascript.questionText: 1)In JavaScript, what is a block of statement?

options.text: b)block that combines a number of statements into a single compound statement
c)both conditional block and a single statement
d)block that contains a single statement

javascript.explanation: In general, a block of statement has common definition which combines one or a number of statements into a single statement for ease.

javascript.questionText: 2)When interpreter encounters an empty statements, what it will do:
javascript.explanation: The empty statements also sometimes very useful like we use the empty statements for creating loop for nothing.

javascript.questionText: 3)Which of the following variables takes precedence over the others if the names are the same?
javascript.explanation: n JavaScript, the local variable takes precedence over the global variable if the name of both local and global variables is the same.

javascript.questionText: 4)Which one of the following is the correct way for calling the JavaScript code?
javascript.explanation: The JavaScript code can be called simply by making the function call to the element on which the JavaScript code execution has to be run.

javascript.questionText: 5)When there is an indefinite or an infinite value during an arithmetic computation in a program, then JavaScript prints______.
javascript.explanation: The result of any numerical operation is beyond the largest negative number, JavaScript prints negative infinity.
